page.title: 20TEXTILES /THE DOMESDAY GROUP
page.content: OUR D-BLOCK WAS ONCE A THRIVING TEXTILE CENTRE WITH FLAXMILLS AND BLEACHFIELDS. CLOTH OR YARN WAS BLEACHED WHITE BY LAYING THE YARN OR CLOTH ON GRASSY AREAS AND LETTING THE SUN, RAIN AND DEW DO THEIR WORK. THE EARLIEST RECORD OF BLEACHING IN THIS AREA WAS BY GEORGE PEIRSON IN 1772. IN THE 19TH CENTURY FIFE WAS THEV ONLY BLEACHING AREA ESPECIALLY ALONG THE BANKS OF THE RIVER LEVEN e.g.WALKERTON TODAY THE ONLY TEXTILE PRODUCTION IS A LADY LIVING IN RYELAW FARM WHO KNITS JERSEYS AND OTHER WOOLLEN GARMENTS FOR PEOPLE WHO SPECIALLY COMMISSION HER. -------------------------------------- GLENWOOD HIGH SCHOOL DOMESDAY GROUP:- 1ST YEAR- Z.ASHER,J.HUGHES L.IRELAND K.CLUNIE,A.DUNCAN,E.WILSON 2ND YEAR- E.DEWAR,T.McQUILLAN, S.PULLAR,M.WILSON, P.GARTSHORE,A.de SOYZA.
